title: Hakeem Jeffries savagely scrutinised online after heated meltdown over Kristi Noem
description: House Democrat Leader Hakeem Jeffries has unleashed on Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem.  Hakeem had recently responded to the death of Renee Good, who was killed by an ICE agent in Minnesota.  Jeffries went on a heated rant about Noem and her department in regard to the death of Good, saying Renee “should be alive today”.  The House Democrat leader accused Noem of “hiding behind her MAGA wardrobe” as well as calling both her and the ICE agent who shot good of having a “depraved indifference toward human life”.

title: Merging of gun changes and hate speech reforms labelled ‘incongruous’
description: Shadow Home Affairs Minister Jonathon Duniam has called the government’s merging of gun changes and hate speech legislation reforms “incongruous”.   “It is complex,” Mr Duniam told Sky News Australia.   “It’s nearly 150 pages of legislation itself.  “We do need to ensure that we get the balance right.”

title: PM has his ‘work cut out’ for him to find a US ambassador who hasn’t slandered Trump previously
description: Shadow Home Affairs Minister Jonathon Duniam wants someone who fills the position as US ambassador to have Australia’s “interests at heart”.   Mr Duniam notes finding a replacement for Kevin Rudd may be hard, due to his past comments about US President Donald Trump.  “I think the government needs to take into account the need for us to have an uncomplicated relationship with the United States,” Mr Duniam told Sky News Australia.   “The government have their work cut out for them, finding someone that can fill that hole.”

title: Penny Wong pressed on government's inaction to antisemitism prior to Bondi attack
description: Sky News Australia has pressed Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong on the government’s inaction against antisemitism before the Bondi Beach attack.  “If these laws are necessary now, would some members of the Jewish community think you should have done this prior?” Sky News Senior Political Reporter Trudy McIntosh said.  “It shouldn’t have taken a terror attack to necessitate these sorts of changes.”

title: Trump claims it is in Greenland’s ‘best interest’ for the US to acquire the country
description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt explains why it’s in Greenland’s “best interest” for US President Donald Trump to acquire the country.   “I think the president was very clear last night. He said that he wants to see the United States acquire Greenland because he feels that if we do not, then it will eventually be acquired or even hostilely taken over,” Ms Leavitt said.  “It would not just be in the best interest of the United States, but perhaps it would be in the best interest of Greenland as well.”

title: Trump asserts himself as 'Acting President' of Venezuela in hilarious Truth Social post
description: US President Donald Trump has made a hilarious Truth Social post claiming to be the “Acting President” of Venezuela.  The photo was a mockup of a Wikipedia article with his new title under his picture.  The US operation in Venezuela, which saw former president Nicolas Maduro and his wife Vilia Flores captured by US forces on January 3.  The Venezuelan leader has been indicted on a range of charges, including Narco-Terrorism Conspiracy and Cocaine Importation Conspiracy.  Trump spoke on his relationship with the new leaders, saying it is “working out well”.

title: Trump ‘unafraid to use military options’ against Iran if diplomacy fails
description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt says Trump will focus on diplomacy with Iran before using military options.  “I think one thing President Trump is very good at is always keeping all of his options on the table, and airstrikes would be one of the many, many options that are on the table,” Ms Leavitt said.  “Diplomacy is always the first option.  “The president has shown he is unafraid to use military options if and when he deems necessary.”

title: Minnesota sues US government over surge of ICE agents into the state
description: Minnesota and the twin cities of Minneapolis and Saint Paul are suing the US federal government over the surge of ICE agents into the state.  The Department of Homeland Security announced it would send more than 2,000 officers to the state after the fatal shooting of a woman by an ICE agent.  The shooting has triggered mass protests across the United States, although the Trump administration has been standing by the ICE officer.  Minnesota is seeking a request to halt the enforcement action or limit the operation.

title: Jacinta Allan provides an update on devastating Victorian bushfires
description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan provides an update on the bushfire situation across the state.  “I also want to recognise and thank those local residents who were able to leave,” Ms Allan said.   “When you get that emergency warning alert on your phone … you must do so because it protects lives, it saves lives.  “Thank you to the local community who took the advice.  “By responding early, we have been able to protect and save lives.”

title: Donald Trump to brutally slap countries trading with Iran with a 25 per cent tariff
description: US President Donald Trump has ruthlessly threatened to hit countries doing business with the Iranian regime with a 25 per cent tariff.  In a post to Truth Social, President Trump described the tariff warning as a “final” trade order targeting Iran and its partners.  "Effective immediately, any Country doing business with the Islamic Republic of Iran will pay a Tariff of 25% on any and all business being done with the United States of America. This Order is final and conclusive. Thank you for your attention to this matter,” Trump wrote.  Trump’s post follows 15 days of protests, which have spiralled out of control as the Iranian government has reportedly killed hundreds of civilians.  According to the Human Rights Activist News Agency (HRANA), up to 544 deaths have been confirmed, with “dozens of additional cases remain under review.”

title: Elizabeth Warren warns Democrat economic policy could be 'doomed to fail'
description: Progressive senator Elizabeth Warren has warned Democrats to stop catering to the wealthy elites if they want to win the midterms this year.  Warren also slammed the notion that the Democratic Party has become "too progressive".  "A Democratic Party that worries more about offending big donors than delivering for working people is a party doomed to fail in 2026, 2028, and beyond," Ms Warren said.  The Massachusetts senator also hit out at the Trump administration's criminal investigation into the US Federal Reserve Chair.  This comes as US President Donald Trump has announced new tariffs on Iran's trade partners.

title: Coalition stands 'ready to work' with government on ‘urgent’ Bondi response
description: Shadow Home Affairs Minister Jonathon Duniam claims the Coalition are “here now” to support the government on hate speech and gun law reforms.   “We wanted urgent action,” Mr Duniam told Sky News Australia.   “We stand ready to work with the government.  “While it’s rushed and urgent, we do need to get it right; that balance is critical.”

title: ‘We should be encouraging boys to be boys’: Relationship education program roll-out in NSW
description: Institute of Public Affairs Research Fellow Colleen Harkin discusses the new relationship education program, which will be rolled out in 150 public schools across New South Wales.  “We have seen loads of schools where boys have been asked to stand up and apologise for being a male,” Ms Harkin told Sky News Senior Reporter Caroline Marcus.  “Traditional masculinity has been promoted as being toxic.  “We should be encouraging boys to be boys.”

title: ‘Make Star Trek real’: Elon Musk welcomes Pete Hegseth to the Texas Starbase
description: Billionaire Elon Musk has welcomed US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth to the Texas Starbase.  Hegseth made the stop at the SpaceX facility as part of his Arsenal of Freedom" tour.  The "Arsenal of Freedom" campaign is to promote the Trump administration's priorities for the US military.  Musk introduced the secretary of war highlighting the importance of local manufacturing to US strength.  Musk also laid out his wishes for SpaceX as a real-world "Starfleet Academy".  Hegseth spoke on the importance of technological innovation to the Department of War.  The secretary of war also spoke on the "risk-averse" military-industrial complex, vowing that the US will gain technological supremacy.

title: Trump ‘feeling confident’ in US military’s ‘tactical abilities’
description: US Studies Centre Research Director Jared Mondschein claims US President Donald Trump is feeling “confident” in the US military’s “tactical abilities”.  “President Trump is pretty confident after seeing what has happened on his last strike on Iran,” Mr Mondschein told Sky News Australia.  “He’s feeling pretty confident in the US military’s tactical abilities.  "He's removing no options on the table."
